translated: Basket of Conduct
The Elephant-trainer’s Chapter
The Perfection of Morality
The Story of Campeyyanāga
“Then again, when I was
Campeyyanāga, the one of great power,
then too I was righteous,
endowed with virtue and austerity.
Then too, when I was living righteously,
observing the Uposatha,
a snake-charmer caught me
and played with me at the king’s gate.
Whatever color he thought of,
blue, yellow, or red,🔽in accordance with his thought
I became like what he had thought of.
I could turn water into land,
and land into water;
if I were to get angry with him,
in an instant I could reduce him to ashes.
If I were to be under the power of my mind,
I would fall away from virtue;
for one who has fallen away from virtue,
the highest goal is not attained.
Let this body be destroyed,
let it be scattered right here;
I would not break my virtue,
even if it were to be scattered like dust.”
The Story of Campeyyanāga, the third.
